snippet: An insurance fraud ring that generated up to $10 million in phony automobile accident claims was cracked today with the arrest of four men, including two lawyers who headed the operation, the authorities said.   Insurance Department investigators ...
lead_paragraph: An insurance fraud ring that generated up to $10 million in phony automobile accident claims was cracked today with the arrest of four men, including two lawyers who headed the operation, the authorities said. Insurance Department investigators arrested the lawyers, Alan M. Shapiro and Warren M. Finn on charges of fraud, conspiracy, money laundering and tax evasion. Also arrested were their office manager, Gaudencio Basa, and David Shin, who was accused of referring clients to them.

headline.main: 2 Lawyers Among 4 Arrested In Insurance Fraud Scheme
